intro: Odontarrhena sibirica, commonly known as Siberian toothbrush, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Siberia and northern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, brush-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and thrives in temperate to subarctic climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in dense clusters. Odontarrhena sibirica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
